content: I've got a large number of resources that I'd like to validate, so I'd like to just include the validator as a library and pass a JSON string to a java function in process. Anybody have experience doing that or an example? Everything I see is either a CLI or web interface. I've got ETL running in Spark so I should be able to call Java functions natively without network or process overhead. Thanks.
Ah, take a look at the validator-wrapper website repo
I pulled down that repo, but I don't see where I'm calling validator as a function. I see web calls, and cli stuff. I'm just looking to do an in-process call.
you can look at NativeHostServices, though that's undertested. Alternatively you can look at the way that Hapi hosts the validator
